exceptions.exn: The LHS of SF_seq_bij (SF_make (SF_lx _) (SF_ly _) (SF_size_lx_ly _)) does not match any subterm of the goal

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
s: SF_seq

Goal:
SF_rev (SF_rev s) = s

Premises:
SF_rev = fun s : SF_seq => SF_make (rev (SF_lx s)) (rev (SF_ly s)) (SF_rev_0 s) : SF_seq -> SF_seq
SF_rev_cons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), SF_rev (SF_cons h s) = SF_rcons (SF_rev s) h
SF_rev_rcons : forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), SF_rev (SF_rcons s t) = SF_cons t (SF_rev s)
SF_size = fun s : SF_seq => size (SF_t s) : SF_seq -> nat
SF_ly = fun s : SF_seq => unzip2 (SF_t s) : SF_seq -> seq T
SF_lx = fun s : SF_seq => SF_h s :: unzip1 (SF_t s) : SF_seq -> seq R
SF_rcons = fun (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T) => {| SF_h := SF_h s; SF_t := rcons (SF_t s) t |} : SF_seq -> R * T -> SF_seq
SF_seq_bij : forall s : SF_seq, SF_make (SF_lx s) (SF_ly s) (SF_size_lx_ly s) = s
SF_h = fun s : SF_seq => let (SF_h, _) := s in SF_h : SF_seq -> R
SF_size_lx : forall s : SF_seq, size (SF_lx s) = S (SF_size s)
SF_t = fun s : SF_seq => let (_, SF_t) := s in SF_t : SF_seq -> seq (R * T)
SF_size_cons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), SF_size (SF_cons h s) = S (SF_size s)
zip_unzip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq (S * T)), zip (unzip1 s) (unzip2 s) = s
rev_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), rev (x :: s) = rcons (rev s) x
SF_cons = fun (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := fst h; SF_t := (SF_h s, snd h) :: SF_t s |} : R * T -> SF_seq -> SF_seq
proj2_sig_of_sig2_eq : forall p : ?u = ?v, eq_rect (proj1_sig (sig_of_sig2 ?u)) (fun a : ?A => ?P a) (proj2_sig (sig_of_sig2 ?u)) (proj1_sig (sig_of_sig2 ?v)) (proj1_sig_of_sig2_eq p) = proj2_sig (sig_of_sig2 ?v) where ?A : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- Type] ?P : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- ?A -> Prop] ?Q : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- ?A -> Prop] ?u : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- {a : ?A | ?P a & ?Q a}] ?v : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- {a : ?A | ?P a & ?Q a}]
SF_size_ly : forall s : SF_seq, size (SF_ly s) = SF_size s
SF_size_lx_ly : forall s : SF_seq, size (SF_lx s) = S (size (SF_ly s))
SF_make : forall (lx : seq R) (ly : seq T), size lx = S (size ly) -> SF_seq
size_rev : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T), size (rev s) = size s
SF_nil = fun x0 : R => {| SF_h := x0; SF_t := [::] |} : R -> SF_seq Argument scope is [R_scope]
SF_size_rcons : forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), SF_size (SF_rcons s t) = S (SF_size s)
SF_lx_rcons : forall (s : SF_seq) (h : R * T), SF_lx (SF_rcons s h) = rcons (SF_lx s) (fst h)
size_rcons : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), size (rcons s x) = S (size s)
SF_lx_cons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), SF_lx (SF_cons h s) = fst h :: SF_lx s
SF_ly_cons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), SF_ly (SF_cons h s) = snd h :: SF_ly s
SF_ly_rcons : forall (s : SF_seq) (h : R * T), SF_ly (SF_rcons s h) = rcons (SF_ly s) (snd h)
rot_oversize : forall (T : Type) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size s) n -> rot n s = s
drop_oversize : forall (T : Type) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size s) n -> drop n s = [::]
take_oversize : forall (T : Type) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size s) n -> take n s = s
eqtype.Sub : forall x : ?T, ?P x -> eqtype.sub_sort ?sT where ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- Type] ?P : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- pred ?T] ?sT : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- eqtype.subType ?P]
SF_cons_rcons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) (l : R * T), SF_cons h (SF_rcons s l) = SF_rcons (SF_cons h s) l
eqtype.SubType : forall (sub_sort : Type) (val : sub_sort -> ?T) (Sub : forall x : ?T, ?P x -> sub_sort), (forall K : sub_sort -> Type, (forall (x : ?T) (Px : ?P x), K (Sub x Px)) -> forall u : sub_sort, K u) -> (forall (x : ?T) (Px : ?P x), val (Sub x Px) = x) -> eqtype.subType ?P where ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- Type] ?P : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- pred ?T]
Record SF_seq : Type := mkSF_seq { SF_h : R; SF_t : seq (R * T) } For mkSF_seq: Argument scopes are [R_scope seq_scope]
SF_rcons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), P (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
SF_cons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), P (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
SF_rcons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), P s -> P (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
SF_cons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), P s -> P (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
rcons_dec : forall P : seq ?T -> Type, P [::] -> (forall (s0 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), P (rcons s0 t)) -> forall s : seq ?T, P s where ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- Type]
rcons_ind : forall P : seq ?T -> Type, P [::] -> (forall (s0 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), P s0 -> P (rcons s0 t)) -> forall s : seq ?T, P s where ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq |- Type]
N.eq_pred_0 : forall n : N, N.pred n = 0%N < -> n = 0%N \/ n = 1%N

Qed.```
